intro: Andrachne decaisneana, commonly known as the mountain heath, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes shrubs and small trees adapted to acidic and nutrient-poor soils. The plant features compact, evergreen foliage with small, leathery leaves that are often covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, arranged in clusters and blooming in late summer. Andrachne decaisneana is well adapted to cold, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes.
